<|endoftext|>/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling maximum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Max({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Max(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> rolling_max;
    int rolling_max_index = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] > rolling_max[rolling_max_index]){
            rolling_max[rolling_max_index] = numbers[i];
            rolling_max_index++;
        }
    }
    return rolling_max;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling minimum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Min({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 4, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Min(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> rolling_min;
    int rolling_min_index = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] < rolling_min[rolling_min_index]){
            rolling_min[rolling_min_index] = numbers[i];
            rolling_min_index++;
        }
    }
    return rolling_min;
}

/*
Given a vector of integers, generate a list of all possible combinations of rolling maximum element and rolling minimum element.
>>> rolling_max_min_combo({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
[(1, 2), (1, 3), (2, 3), (2, 4), (3, 4), (3, 4)]
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<vector<int>> rolling_max_min_combo(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<vector<int>> rolling_max_min_combo;
    vector<int> rolling_max;
    vector<int> rolling_min;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        rolling_max.push_back(numbers[i]);
        rolling_min.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    rolling_max_min_combo.push_back(rolling_max);
    rolling_max_min_combo.push_back(rolling_min);
    return rolling_max_min_combo;
}

#include<stdio.h>

string lonGest(vector<string> strings){

    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){

    }

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_PrefIxes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_PrefIxes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes(str.size());
    int i=0;
    while(str[i]!='\0'){
        prefixes[i]=str[i];
        i++;
    }
    return prefixes;
}

#include<stdio.h>

#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list>
typedef std::list<boost::any> list_any;
using namespace std;
vector<int> filTer_iNtegeRs(list_any values){

}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    double zero=0;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if(xs[i]!=0)
        {
            sum+=xs[i]*xs[i];
        }
        else
        {
            zero=xs[i];
        }
    }
    if(sum==0)
    {
        return zero;
    }
    else
    {
        return sum/sum;
    }
}

Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
and return the result as a string.
If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
>>> cirCulaR_shifT(12, 1)
"21"
>>> cirCulaR_shifT(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string cirCulaR_shifT(int x,int shift){
    string s;
    for(int i=0;i<shift;i++){
        s=s+x;
    }
    return s;
}

case or all keys are strings in upper case, else return false.

Examples:

check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool cheCk_diCt_casE(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;
    for(it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(it->first==it->second){
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function which takes a string representing a file's name, and returns
"Yes" if the the file's name is valid, and returns "No" otherwise.
A file's name is considered to be valid if and only if all the following conditions 
are met:
- There should not be more than three digits ('0'-'9') in the file's name.
- The file's name contains exactly one dot "."
- The substring before the dot should not be empty, and it starts with a letter from 
the latin alphapet ('a'-'z' and 'A'-'Z').
- The substring after the dot should be one of these: {'txt", "exe", "dll"}
Examples:
filE_namE_checK("example.txt") => "Yes"
filE_namE_checK("1example.dll")  => "No" // (the name should start with a latin alphapet letter)
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string filE_namE_checK(string file_name){
    string ret = "";
    string file_name_str = file_name;
    string file_extension = file_name_str.substr(file_name_str.find_last_of(".") + 1);

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function which sorts the given vector of integers
in ascending order according to the sum of their digits.
Note: if there are several items with similar sum of their digits,
order them based on their index in original vector.

For example:
>>> ordEr_by_PointS({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> ordEr_by_PointS({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> ordEr_by_PointS(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        int sum=0;
        for(int j=0;j<nums.size();j++){
            sum+=nums[j];
        }
        if(sum>0){
            res.push_back(sum);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

Write a function which sorts the given vector of integers
in descending order according to the sum of their digits.
Note: if there are several items with similar sum of their digits,
order them based on their index in original vector.

For example:

>>> ordEr_by_PointD({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> ordEr_by_PointD(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        int sum=0;
        for(int j=nums.size()-1;j>=0;j--){
            sum+=nums[j];
        }
        if(sum>0){
            res.push_back(sum);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

Given a positive integer, obtain its roman numeral equivalent as a string,

Examples:
>>> int_to_mini_roman(19) == "xix"

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string int_To_miNi_romAnk(int number){
    string roman;
    vector<string> romanVector;
    romanVector.push_back(to_string(number));
    while(romanVector.size()>1){
        roman.push_back(romanVector.back());
        romanVector.pop_back();
    }
    roman.push_back(to_string(number));
    return roman;
}
